title: US criticism of Israeli settlements is ‘meaningless’: Analysts
description: Washington says it is 'deeply troubled' by settlement expansion but rejects UN efforts to denounce Israeli policies.

title: Crypto exchange Binance pulls back on some US investments
description: Binance is considering ending business relationships with banks and services firms amid heightened scrutiny.

title: Closed terminal at New York’s JFK airport causes delays
description: A power outage caused by an isolated fire has disrupted flights at one of the busiest airports in the world.

title: Turkey finds new survivors as quake death toll exceeds 43,000
description: Even as the window for finding people alive shrank, rescuers removed several survivors from under the rubble.

title: How will the African Union manage the continent?
description: The bloc's leaders gather again as Africa is grappling with many challenges.

title: Zelenskyy urges speedy arms support to thwart Russian ambitions
description: Ukrainian president warns at security conference that delays in military aid would play into Moscow's hands.

title: UN calls move to strip Nicaraguan dissidents’ citizenship illegal
description: UN chief Guterres said that the right to nationality was 'fundamental' and should not be weaponised against critics.

title: Doctors from Qatar, US work to save quake survivors in NW Syria
description: Medical specialists have entered opposition-held areas, bringing much-needed expertise and supplies.

title: Trudeau’s use of emergency powers to end convoy justified: Panel
description: Canada prime minister met legal threshold to invoke Emergencies Act to disperse 2022 'Freedom Convoy', commission finds.

title: El Salvador prisoner ‘rearrests’ fuel new concerns
description: Growing number of people detained in gang crackdown being 'rearrested', experts say, raising fears policy will not end.

title: ISIL leader killed, 4 US troops injured in Syria raid: Pentagon
description: US military says 'senior' ISIL official Hamza al-Homsi was killed in helicopter raid in northeastern Syria.

title: US completes recovery of downed Chinese balloon debris
description: US officials say that analysis of debris confirms suspicions that balloon was for surveillance, which China denies.

title: At least 18 people found dead in abandoned truck in Bulgaria
description: Health minister says 34 survivors, including 5 children, were rushed to hospitals and some were in critical condition.

title: Ex-US police officers plead not guilty to killing Tyre Nichols
description: Five former officers face second-degree murder charges, among others, in death of 29-year-old Black motorist in Memphis.

title: ‘I was naive about Russia’: Central Asians on the Ukraine war
description: Central Asian states keep close ties with Moscow, but younger citizens of ex-Soviet nations are questioning alliances.

title: Armed men attack police compound in Pakistan’s Karachi
description: Gunfire and explosions heard outside the compound in the southern Pakistani city, according to local media.

title: Nigeria’s elections have bigger problems than vote trading
description: Buying votes is a problem — but only because of a deeper rot in Nigeria's democracy that it must address.

title: India accuses BBC of tax evasion after searching offices
description: Critics questioned the timing of the searches, which came after BBC aired show critical of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy says Putin will target other ex-Soviet states
description: 'It's obvious that Ukraine is not going to be his last stop,' the president tells world leaders meeting in Germany.

title: British embassy guard who spied for Russia jailed for 13 years
description: David Smith was caught in a sting operation after passing sensitive material to the Russian embassy in Germany.

title: China declares ‘decisive victory’ over COVID
description: Politburo Standing Committee says more than 200 million received medical treatment including some 800,000 severe cases.

title: Which countries recognise Kosovo’s statehood?
description: Kosovo declared itself a sovereign state 15 years ago, but countries including Serbia do not recognise its independence.

title: Turkey earthquake: In hard-hit Adiyaman, no peace for survivors
description: Residents in southeastern Turkish city reel from earthquakes that killed thousands and caused widespread devastation.

title: Seattle council to vote on law banning caste discrimination
description: City councillor says proposed bill would help end 'invisible and unaddressed' problem affecting South-Asian Americans.

title: Wave of raids, arrests target government critics in Tunisia
description: The crackdown on opponents of President Saied has sparked international criticism and fears of a return to autocracy.

title: India’s BJP slams Soros for saying Adani crisis will weaken Modi
description: The financier-philanthropist has predicted Adani Group's woes would loosen the Hindu nationalist leader's grip on power.

title: After surviving earthquake, Syrian family of seven dies in fire
description: The Syrian family had moved to the central region of Konya from the southeastern Turkish city of Nurdagi.

title: Past COVID infection lowers risk of hospitalisation, death: Study
description: The report by The Lancet found that 'natural immunity' reduces the risk of hospitalisation and death by 88 percent.

title: Why India’s Ladakh region is now fighting for full statehood
description: Three years after Ladakh was separated from Indian-administered Kashmir, residents say they want more safeguards.

title: For many Ukrainians, everyday Russians are as guilty as Putin
description: As the first anniversary of the war approaches, Ukrainians say Russians should be doing more to stop the bloodshed.

title: What’s frontotemporal dementia? A look at Bruce Willis’ diagnosis
description: FTD is an umbrella term for disorders affecting the areas of the brain that deal with personality behaviour and language

title: Why are so many journalists being killed in Mexico?
description: 'What is happening in Mexico is a human rights emergency,' says journalist and author Anabel Hernandez.

title: South Korean defence minister denies Vietnam War massacres
description: Minister said court ruling dishonoured South Korean soldiers by finding them responsible for massacre of civilians.

title: The cost of the Democratic Republic of the Congo’s war with M23
description: The DRC’s Minister of Communications, Patrick Muyaya, on the fighting in his country and Rwanda's role in the conflict.

title: US President Joe Biden is healthy, ‘fit for duty’, says doctor
description: Polls indicate voters have concerns about Biden's ability to serve four more years if he wins in 2024.

title: TikTok eyes European data centres amid regulatory pressure
description: Top executive says video-sharing app aims to expand its data storage with two more centres in Europe.

title: North Korea warns of military action over joint S Korea-US drills
description: North Korean spokesperson said 'strong counteractions' would follow if South Korea and the US conducted military drills.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 359
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 359th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Syria’s Assad thanks ‘Arab brothers’ as quakes stir aid diplomacy
description: The quakes have given the isolated Syrian leader a shot at engaging with neighbours.

title: Thailand’s economy slows amid declining exports, manufacturing
description: Southeast Asia's second-largest economy grows 1.4 percent in last quarter of 2022 amid hopes for tourism-led recovery.

title: Tesla hikes prices of Model Y in China
description: Electric car maker raises prices in China for second time since price cuts in January.

title: Alarm grows over WFP plan to cut food aid for Rohingya refugees
description: Experts say reduction would be 'catastrophic' for hundreds of thousands living in Bangladesh camps.

title: China’s top tech dealmaker Bao Fan goes missing
description: The billionaire investment banker is unreachable, according to the investment bank he founded.

title: Japan’s new H3 space rocket fails to blast off
description: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency said the H3’s main engine had ignited but two booster engines failed.

title: Sri Lanka’s Chinese-built port city stirs white elephant fears
description: Sri Lankans are questioning the feasibility of Port City Colombo as their country faces its worst economic crisis.

title: Suspect in Half Moon Bay mass shooting pleads not guilty
description: The 66-year-old former farmworker is accused of killing seven people in back-to-back shootings in California last month.

title: Indonesia stadium crush trial hit by claims of intimidation
description: Police were filmed heckling prosecutors at trial of five people, including three police officers, over Malang disaster.

title: Family of actor Bruce Willis announces ‘painful’ new diagnosis
description: Willis, famous for films like Die Hard, retired from acting in 2022 after suffering from the language disorder aphasia.

title: Canada to send warships to Haiti amid ongoing violence
description: Violence from powerful criminal organisations has racked the island since the assassination of President Jovenel Moise.
